type.name: condition_date
type.description: The date which the current condition is created of updated.

type.name: condition_identification
type.description: The idnetifier or version identifier of the condition.

type.name: criterion_specification
type.description: Selection between a simple textual description or a fully established expression construct.

type.name: organization_ownership
type.description: The organization which authers and maitains the Condition definition.

entity.name: Compound_criteria
entity.description: A Compound_criterioa is an aggregation of multiple crterion instances through a logical operator. The aggregation operations of AND_structure and OR_structure may be nested.

entity.name: Condition
entity.description: A Condition is a predicate that states the allowable TRUE values of the properties of an object or relationship in considerwation.

explicit.name: criterion
explicit.description: The criterion that defines the condition.

explicit.name: role
explicit.description:
The role of the condition.
EXAMPLE: Validity, applicability, state

explicit.name: role
explicit.description: The meaning or implication of the relationship.

entity.name: Criterion
entity.description: A Criterion is a Logical_expression that relates an operator to one or more operands. Criterion expressions can be nested to form complex logical constructs.

entity.name: Criterion_parameter
entity.description: A specific property value that constitutes the criterion definition.

explicit.name: parameter_name
explicit.description: A name lable of the parameter identified in the criterion. This name should be in comliance with the actual property name used by the user entity or community. The name can be retrieved through a query following the path reference of the Parameter_ source_reference.

explicit.name: parameter_type
explicit.description: A type descritor of the parameter.

explicit.name: parameter_value
explicit.description:
The value of a parameter. In some parameters, the value construct may contain the name, structure and applicable measure of the parameter.
EXAMPLE: A date value may be composed of named integer values of Year, Month and Date in addition to a string date type indicator.

entity.name: Parameter_source_reference
entity.description:
A referencing relationship to the actual source instance of a property value, from which the criterion parameter is based. The reference path also facilitates the validation evaluation process in applications.
EXAMPLE: If a Class identifier is used as a criterion, the reference may point to the actual Class repository where member instances of the class can be found.

explicit.name: source
explicit.description: A pointer to the actual entity instance from which this parameter value is based.
